doi_validation.syntax: Valid DOI format with https://doi.org/ prefix
doi_validation.notes: DOI is properly formatted and matches Dataverse pattern

grant_validation.notes: Grant ID properly formatted but appears only in comment, not in structured funders field

identifier_consistency.subset_consistency: PASS - All subset IDs follow consistent cm4ai: namespace pattern

restrictions.attribution: Required to copyright holders and authors

copyright_holders: The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University (spatial proteomics raw image data)
license_semantic_check.semantic_clarity: EXCELLENT - Clear license specification with detailed copyright attribution

temporal_consistency.consistency: PASS - Reasonable publication delay after creation
temporal_consistency.version_semantics: Indicates ongoing development with multiple prior releases

metadata_richness.semantic_coherence: EXCELLENT - Keywords span technical, biological, and methodological domains

institutions_mentioned: University of Alabama at Birmingham (UA Birmingham)
institutional_attribution.point_of_contact: Trey Ideker (University of California San Diego)
institutional_attribution.attribution_completeness: EXCELLENT - Clear multi-institutional attribution with roles

scientific_terminology.ontology_ready: Partially - Some terms are standard ontology concepts (iPSC, protein localization), others are method-specific
scientific_terminology.semantic_precision: HIGH - Technical terminology is specific and domain-appropriate

data_type_semantics.semantic_organization: EXCELLENT - Clear categorization by data type, cell type, and treatment condition

provenance_semantics.provenance_level: EXCELLENT - Explicit provenance tracking with standardized packaging

sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.semantic_notes: DOI present in id field with proper URI format, format validated

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness

values.title: Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence - March 2025 Data Release (Beta)

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Comprehensive title and description; description includes project scope, data types, methods, and institutional collaborators

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Rich keyword set covering AI, methods, cell types, diseases, and standards

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Landing page URL present and consistent with DOI; no hierarchical resources field (flat dataset structure)

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No parent_datasets or related_datasets fields; however, 5 well-documented subsets present with consistent naming; external resources link to project website and publications

element_scores.semantic_summary: Excellent discovery metadata with persistent DOI, comprehensive description, rich keywords, and well-structured subsets. No explicit hierarchical relationships but clear internal organization.

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.semantic_notes: License clearly specified with detailed copyright attribution; no IP restrictions documented

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No regulatory restrictions or confidentiality level specified; cell line data may not require this

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No explicit download_url field; distribution_formats contains access_urls pointing to Dataverse landing page

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Distribution format with access URL present; specific file formats not detailed in top-level fields but RO-Crate format mentioned in preprocessing

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.semantic_notes: External resources link to project website and two bioRxiv publications; no formal related_datasets field

element_scores.semantic_summary: Good access metadata with clear licensing and external resources. Missing explicit download URLs (relies on Dataverse interface) and no regulatory/confidentiality specifications.

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Clear license allowing non-commercial reuse with attribution and share-alike requirements

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No top-level format or encoding fields; RO-Crate mentioned but not formally specified in schema fields

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No explicit conforms_to or conforms_to_schema fields; FAIRSCAPE framework mentioned but not formalized

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No variables field; dataset contains multiple heterogeneous data types not suited to variable-level metadata

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Discouraged uses documented; future_use_impacts provides usage context; no explicit intended_uses or prohibited_uses fields

element_scores.semantic_summary: Adequate reuse guidance through licensing and use warnings. Lacks formal standardization metadata (format, encoding, schema conformance) and variable-level descriptions. Multi-modal nature makes variable metadata less applicable.

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No ethical review documentation; dataset uses cell lines (iPSCs, cancer cell lines) not human subjects research

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No deidentification field; not applicable to cell line data

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Not applicable - cell line research without human participants

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Not applicable - cell line research without human participants

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Not applicable - cell line research without human participants

element_scores.semantic_summary: Element not applicable - this is cell line research (iPSCs and cancer cell lines) without human subjects. Zero score reflects absence of human subjects fields, not ethical deficiency.

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No subpopulations field; not applicable to cell line data (no demographic cohorts)

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported

values.instance_description: 11,739 targeted genes (CRISPRi), 563 proteins (IF imaging), multiple cell types (SEC-MS)

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Instances field provides comprehensive description of data scale across multiple modalities

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No variables or is_tabular fields; multi-modal dataset (sequencing, mass spec, imaging) not purely tabular

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Instances description covers cell types, experimental conditions, and biological topics

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented

values.sampling_strategy: Disease-relevant cell lines selected for AI-ready functional genomics mapping

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Sampling strategies documented; no anomalies field present

element_scores.semantic_summary: Good composition metadata with clear instance counts and sampling strategies. Missing formal variable metadata and tabular flag (appropriate for multi-modal data). No subpopulations (not applicable to cell lines).

sub_elements.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No top-level version field; version 1.4 mentioned in updates section

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented

values.version_access: Dataset versioned through University of Virginia Dataverse with DOI persistence

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Version access clearly documented with Dataverse versioning system

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided

values.updates: Data will be augmented regularly through end of Bridge2AI project

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Update plan documented; no errata field (expected for recent release)

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated

values.update_schedule: Regular data augmentation planned through Bridge2AI project end

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Update frequency clearly stated as regular augmentation

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No was_derived_from or release_notes fields; provenance described narratively in preprocessing section (FAIRSCAPE provenance graphs)

element_scores.semantic_summary: Good version tracking with clear Dataverse versioning and update plans. Missing top-level version number and formal provenance fields, though provenance is addressed through FAIRSCAPE framework.

sub_elements.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation

values.purpose: Create AI-ready maps of human cell architecture from disease-relevant cell lines

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Clear purpose aligned with Bridge2AI Functional Genomics Grand Challenge

sub_elements.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks

values.task: Enable AI/machine learning research on functional genomics data

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Research objectives clearly stated with focus on AI/ML applications

sub_elements.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No funders field; funding information present only in comment (NIH 1OT2OD032742-01)

sub_elements.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Grant ID present in comment but not in structured funders field; proper NIH format validated

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented

values.creators_in_comment: Multi-institutional consortium led by Trey Ideker, Tim Clark, Nevan Krogan, Emma Lundberg, Prashant Mali, Andrej Sali

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Creator information present in comments and data_collectors section but not in structured creators field

element_scores.semantic_summary: Good motivation and task documentation. Funding and creator information present but not in structured fields (appears in comments and narrative descriptions). Grant ID validated as proper NIH format.

sub_elements.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Collection mechanisms well documented with specific instruments and protocols

sub_elements.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Acquisition methods comprehensive with was_directly_observed flag and detailed acquisition_details

sub_elements.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies

values.preprocessing: RO-Crate packaging with FAIRSCAPE framework, provenance metadata, ontology annotations

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Preprocessing strategies documented; focus on packaging and metadata rather than raw data cleaning

sub_elements.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No software_and_tools field; specific analysis software not documented

sub_elements.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_elements.semantic_notes: External resources linked; RO-Crate and FAIRSCAPE standards mentioned but not in conforms_to field

element_scores.semantic_summary: Excellent technical transparency with detailed collection mechanisms, acquisition methods, and preprocessing strategies. Missing formal software documentation. Standards referenced narratively but not in structured conforms_to field.

sub_elements.name: Known Limitations Documented
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No known_limitations field; cell line-specific warnings in future_use_impacts but not formalized

sub_elements.name: Systematic Biases Identified and Described
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No known_biases field present

sub_elements.name: Data Anomalies and Quality Issues Noted
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No anomalies field present

sub_elements.name: Sensitive Content and Warnings Provided
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No sensitive_elements or content_warnings fields; not applicable to cell line data

sub_elements.name: Ethical Review Details Including Conflicts
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No ethical_reviews field; not applicable to cell line research

element_scores.semantic_summary: No formal limitations, biases, or ethical review documentation. Some usage context provided in future_use_impacts (cell line-specific warnings). Low score reflects missing structured fields rather than quality concerns - cell line data may have fewer ethical considerations than human subjects data.

sub_elements.name: Dataset Published on a Recognized Platform

values.platform: University of Virginia Dataverse (mentioned in URLs)

sub_elements.semantic_notes: Published on Dataverse but no structured publisher field

sub_elements.name: Citation and DOI for Cross-referencing
sub_elements.semantic_notes: DOI present enabling citation; no recommended citation field

sub_elements.name: Community Standards or Schema Conformance
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Standards mentioned in preprocessing but not in conforms_to field

sub_elements.name: Outreach Materials and Documentation Links
sub_elements.semantic_notes: Project website and publications linked; Dataverse page provides access

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets with Typed Relationships
sub_elements.semantic_notes: No related_datasets field with typed relationships

element_scores.semantic_summary: Moderate integration with DOI for cross-referencing and external resources. Missing structured publisher, citation, conforms_to, and related_datasets fields. Platform (Dataverse) and standards (RO-Crate, FAIRSCAPE) mentioned narratively.

strengths: Excellent discovery metadata with persistent DOI, comprehensive description, and rich keywords (Element 1: 100%)
Strong technical transparency with detailed collection mechanisms, acquisition methods, and preprocessing strategies (Element 8: 80%)
Clear licensing with CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 and detailed copyright attribution
Good composition metadata with instance counts, sampling strategies, and subset organization
Version tracking and update plans documented through Dataverse
Well-validated DOI and grant ID formats with semantic consistency
Multi-modal dataset well-described (transcriptomic, proteomic, imaging data)
FAIRSCAPE and RO-Crate standards mentioned for provenance and packaging
weaknesses: No formal ethical review documentation (Element 4: 0%) - though not applicable to cell line research
No structured limitations, biases, or anomalies fields (Element 9: 0%)
Funding and creator information present only in comments, not structured fields (Element 7: 40%)
Missing formal schema conformance and standardization metadata (Element 3: 40%)
No structured publisher, citation, or related_datasets fields (Element 10: 40%)
Missing explicit download URLs (relies on Dataverse interface)
No variable-level metadata (appropriate for multi-modal data but reduces interoperability score)
Standards (RO-Crate, FAIRSCAPE) mentioned narratively but not in conforms_to field
semantic_insights: DOI format validated: 10.18130/V3/B35XWX follows Dataverse pattern
Grant ID validated: NIH 1OT2OD032742-01 follows standard NIH format (OT2 activity code, OD institute)
Identifier consistency: DOI referenced consistently in id and page fields
Subset IDs follow consistent cm4ai: namespace pattern
Temporal consistency: 4-day publication delay after creation is reasonable
License semantics: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 properly interpreted with clear restrictions
Multi-institutional attribution is comprehensive and clear
Keyword categories span technical, biological, and methodological domains
Cell line data appropriately lacks human subjects ethical fields
FAIRSCAPE provenance claims are substantive (RO-Crate packaging with provenance graphs)
applicability_notes: Element 4 (Ethics) scored 0% but is not applicable - cell line research without human participants
Element 3 (Reuse) scored lower due to multi-modal nature lacking tabular variable metadata
Element 9 (Limitations) scored 0% - some usage guidance exists but not in structured limitation fields
Beta release status (v1.4) may explain absence of some retrospective fields (errata, known issues)

critical: Add structured funders field with grant information (currently only in comments)
Add structured creators field with institutional affiliations
Add conforms_to field specifying RO-Crate and FAIRSCAPE standards
Add explicit download_url field for direct data access
important: Add structured publisher field (University of Virginia Dataverse)
Add top-level version field (currently mentioned only in updates)
Add format and encoding fields for primary data types
Document known_limitations specific to cell line models and treatment conditions
Add related_datasets field linking to parent NIH Bridge2AI program or related CM4AI releases
nice_to_have: Add software_and_tools field documenting analysis pipelines
Add conforms_to_schema field referencing D4D schema
Add was_derived_from field for provenance chain
Add release_notes field documenting version history
Formalize subset relationships using related_datasets with typed relationships
Add variables metadata for tabular subsets (e.g., perturb-seq data)
